unnormalised: **Environmental News: Tackling the Kachra Crisis - Delhi's New Initiative**
normalised: **Environmental News: Tackling the Waste Crisis - Delhi's New Initiative**

unnormalised: Namaste, folks! Let's talk trash, shall we? Delhi, our ever-bustling capital, is facing a monumental *kachra* (waste) problem. Mountains of the stuff are piling up faster than you can say "Swachh Bharat Mission," and it's becoming a real headache.
normalised: Namaste, folks! Let's talk trash, shall we? Delhi, our ever-bustling capital, is facing a monumental waste problem. Mountains of the stuff are piling up faster than you can say "Swachh Bharat Mission," and it's becoming a real headache.

unnormalised: But here's a spot of good news! The Delhi Municipal Corporation (MCD) just announced a new waste management initiative, starting 26/01/2024, aiming to reduce landfill waste by 30% in the next year.
normalised: But here's a spot of good news! The D-e-l-h-i Municipal Corporation (M-C-D) just announced a new waste management initiative, starting twenty-sixth January two thousand and twenty four, aiming to reduce landfill waste by thirty percent in the next year.

unnormalised: The plan involves enhanced door-to-door collection (think more efficient rickshaws!), improved segregation at source (separating that sabzi peel from plastic bottles), and building more waste-to-energy plants. Remember the Ghazipur landfill? They are working towards turning it into a green space by 2027, a real landmark project.
normalised: The plan involves enhanced door-to-door collection (think more efficient rickshaws!), improved segregation at source (separating that sabzi peel from plastic bottles), and building more waste-to-energy plants. unnormalised: They held a press conference at 11:00 hrs yesterday, where officials stated community participation is key. Think your local RWA getting involved!
normalised: They held a press conference at eleven hundred hours yesterday, where officials stated community participation is key. Think your local R-W-A getting involved!

unnormalised: Apparently, they are investing Rs. 50 crore in the first phase, aiming to process 5000 tonnes of waste daily. Hopefully, by 15/08/2024, we'll see a noticeable difference.
normalised: Apparently, they are investing rupee fifty crore in the first phase, aiming to process five thousand tonnes of waste daily. Hopefully, by fifteenth August two thousand and twenty four, we'll see a noticeable difference.

unnormalised: The aim is to finally have a cleaner Delhi, a Delhi that makes Mahatma Gandhi proud. What do you think, will this *nayi shuruwat* (new beginning) finally work? Let us know!
